Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: unabelessa
Reviews.Content: We've booked a "double superior room" in advance and I guess we got a really good price: 390 euro for 4 nights. The room was quite good, clean, confortable, spacious and was located in the first floor (the same as the restaurant), heading to Via Mario de' Fiori. I imagine that if it was summer time it would be a bit noisy due to the restaurants down at the street, but it was winter time and noise was absolutely no problem. Bathroom was also spacious, but the shower itself was quite small. Breakfast was ok, they have an excellent expresso. Staff was kind and helpful though a little circumspect. We've booked an early taxi to take us to the airport and it was there 10 min earlier, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK accomodations”
Reviews.Author: billharley
Reviews.Content: This small hotel, located just a block from the Spanish Steps, has a near perfect location. We (both 60) were able to walk to the all of the 'must see' tourist attractions of Rome; from the Vatican and its museums, to the ancient sites, to many of the outstanding churches, and to the elegant shopping areas of Via Condotti and Via del Corso (both just around the corner). The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, providing useful maps and dining suggestions. Room 108 ('Deluxe Superior') was large and featured a modern bathroom with bidet, but with no tub and a confining shower enclosure. Water pressure and hot water were ample. TV had one English language program (CNN) and an extensive selection of local channels. The hotel was undergoing some renovation that added some noise and construction activity to the lobby area. Breakfast was modest, but quite adequate, served in a tiny room (the patio was closed due to the cold weather). We recommend this hotel and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Tara525
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Perfect location, nice rooms, basic breakfast provided. We really enjoyed our time here. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel; Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: lisa k
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last week for three nights. The location is absolutely amazing; super close to the Spanish Steps and walking distance to the entire city including the Forum and Vatican. Everyone on staff was very helpful with everything from maps and directions to restaurant suggestions to internet access. The room (104) was comfortable and clean. Overall our experience there was lovely and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Verena E
Reviews.Content: A stones throw away from the Spanish Steps, right in the heart of the upmarket shopping area. We had a quad room, 1 dble bed and 2 singles, just big enough for the 4 of us, overlooking the busy street below but that gave us atmosphere, everyone went home to their beds around midnight so the noise wasn't an issue. The bathroom was a decent size, bed & pillows very comfy and the shutters ensured total darkness. A great little hotel. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: slg_one
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May. The hotel is on a small street (Via Mario De Fiori) very close to the Spanish Steps. We had a superior double, which was a nice sized room and bathroom (with Jacuzzi tub). Bed was comfy and there was a desk and extra chair for lounging. Room also had a small refrigerator with coke, beer and wine for about 8 euros each. Room was all the way at the top of the stair, but there is a small elevator that will accommodate one person at a time with luggage. The hotel offered free internet, but you'll need an ethernet cable, as it's not wireless. They have extra cables at the front desk they they lend out for no charge. Front desk staff were very nice. One of the ladies spoke 6 different languages (italian, spanish, french, english, german, and russian). They all speak fluent english, so there was no language problem. Our room faced Mario De Fiori, which is quite during the morning before the restaurants open. From about 11am to 11pm you can here the chatter of dishes, the crowds, and street musicians. This was not a bad thing, we enjoyed the action. The free breakfast included european cereals, yogurt, cheeses and meats, rolls, coffee and juices. It's not exactly what you would have in America, but this is Rome. Ladies that set up the breakfast are very nice. It's very close to the Spanish Steps, Villa Borgese, and the Metro, and within walking distance to all the other attractions. We walked the entire city and this is very easy and great way to experience Rome. There are several restaurants on Mario De Fiore, but they are very pricey by American standards. The most reasonable place we found was called Fior Fiore which is on Via Della Croce right around the corner. They has very good pizza and pasta for fair prices.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: cluffne
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms 210 and 104. Superior room 210 was at the street side of the building and was cozy for the double bed room. Bathroom was squeezy but functional. Standard Room 104, was rear facing and had more room. Bathroom was good size. Internet was pay only, WIFI was not available in the building. Staff were very pleasent, with breakfast sufficient to kick the day off. This hotel building is very old, and tastefuly decrorated to suit the period. Beds were very comfortable. Central location to the Spanish Steps and Metro Station, 10 min walk to Hardrock cafe, Trevie Fountain, Panthenon, and not much further to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great lcoation”
Reviews.Author: bubba65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a small street at the foot of the Spanish Steps and a 2-minute walk to a main shopping area or the subway. It is in the coenter of attractions and easy to get around. The rroms are clean, but small as one might expect in Rome. Bath was very small but manageable. Breakast was nice, but not outstanding. Woudl stay again if I wanted to be in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, modest price -- 3 stars about right”
Reviews.Author: juddyray
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Spanish steps and Metro, so the location is fine. Rooms are small, but reasonably comfortable. Breakfast was not extravagant but certainly acceptable. Internet was great. A/C was necessary and worked except for a few hours one day, so that would be the biggest criticism. Staff was excellent in assisting with questions and arranging transportation and restaurant reservations. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you really want for a fabulous location in Rome?!”
Reviews.Author: Talia1284
Reviews.Content: I think everyone would agree with me that since that start of Tripadvisor (the great service that it is), it really is not very easy to book a hotel. You find something, think the location is brilliant, all sounds positive until you read the reviews telling you to stay well away! With my flights to Rome booked, it took an extra month to find a decent sounding hotel. Having been to Rome before I knew that I wanted to stay in the Historical/Medievel quarter, which is exactly where the Piazza Di Spagna is. The taxi driver dropped us off in the rain at The Pantheon and told us that it was just around the corner, who knows why he couldnt take us to the door as this is where we were collected from. Its not hard to find, but it was raining and on a Friday night, the streets were busy. Hotel Piaza Di Spagna is on a gorgeous cobbled street bustling with several restaurants, ivy covered walls and very typical of what you'd expect a narrow street in Old Rome would look like. The staff were fantastic and couldnt be more helpful, they recommend local eateries, helped with directions and booked us a taxi for the journey back. Our room was very sweet and traditional looking and very comfortable. Who cares if there may have been a tad of peeling wallpaper or a limscale stain, does this really ruin your stay? The bathroom had a large bath with jacuzzi jets - perfect for relaxing in after a long day. Both the room and bathroom were large and the shutters kept out the majority of noise and enabled a great night sleep (comfy bed too). Both were very clean and neat. Breakfast was very basic, but did the job. A selection of cakes, slices of baguette, cheese plate, ham, cereals and fruit. Perfect continental combination. You can either sit in the small room off of the kitchen (about 12 seats, but it wasnt ever full) or the outside courtyard. The location was great and within walking distance of everywhere with fabulous boutiques locally. There wasn't anything I disliked about the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay again or recommend to friends. You have to take all reviews with 'a pinch of salt' and not be worried about silly little comments which would not alter the important things like location or service.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: ironman01
Reviews.Content: I had a very bad experience with the this hotel that I want to share with you. I was booked to stay at the hotel for 3 nights in May 2011. Unfortunately I had a fall at home prior to setting out on my vacation and I shattered my knee cap. This required surgery and meant that I had to cancel my Italy holiday. My wife called the hotel on the day of my fall, when I was in emergency at the hospital (it was 17 April) and advised them that we needed to cancel our trip because of these very unfortunate circumstances. We were told that they needed the approval of their manager, Simona, prior to processing our request. After exchanges of emails, Simona advised that they could not refund any part of the booking as it had been done as part of a discounted offer. Then on 21 April the hotel proceeded to charge my credit card with the full expense. So.....here is the thing....despite calling them as soon as possible on 17 April so as to give them a chance to use the room for another customer.....despite the fact that I was the victim of an accident.....Simona and the hotel still went ahead and charged my credit card on 21 April. The best I can say is that these people (Simona) have no compassion. The worst I can say is that they are dishonest choosing to process the credit card expense 5 days after they were advised of my problems. The strange thing is that the hotels we booked in Venice and Florence were totally understanding with one making a refund and the other, who like Hotel Piazza di Spagna, had not processed the credit card expense, choosing to not process the expense. I am a great believer in karma...particularly as you travel the world and share good times and sometimes bad times with fellow travelers. I try to be fair and reasonable. Hotel Piazza di Spagna, and Simona in particular, are not fair and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “a charming boutique hotel walking distance to everything beautiful Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: JoyaSydney
Reviews.Content: After travelling 24 hours from Sydney, what we need was to immerse ourselves into the Roman streets, eat and then sleep. And in this charming and welcoming hotel, minutes away from the Piazza di Spagna, we could do all that and more. I've stayed here a couple of times because the rooms 'feel' very Italian (even the sheets 'feel' Italian) and to my relief when you close those shutters the room is gloriously dark and quiet ( even if outside the Roman streets are bustling). The rooms I have stayed in are not large, but when in Rome you want to see Rome, so returning to a really comfortable bed with a great shower is all we needed. I travelled with my 12 year old daughter and she really loved staying there. Watching Italian TV game shows was a real insight ! And the quiet was very condusive to the 'compulsory' reading on the bed in the late afternoon, before we ventured out for a gelato and a stroll in the evening.And stroll we did....because the hotel is close to everywhere and everything. The staff are always there, always helpful, and always ready to suggest wonderful things to do and how to get there. I still thank my friend for recommending this hotel to me. and she has recently reprimanded me for not writing a Review before...so here it is. Enjoy your stay....I will certainly be back....maybe next time for a romantic stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EulessYogi
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review with updated information because the last one I saw on this hotel was 2007. Overall this hotel was good but seemed a little pricey ($210/night). Rome is more expensive compared to what I am used to so not sure if you would be able to find better value for the price. Location - Good Location near Spanish Steps. We were able to walk everywhere (Vatican City, Colosseum, Navona Square) without a problem. Hotel is on a street that has low traffic volume but this was an issue for us because we were on the first floor. We could hear lots of activity outside early in the morning. Room/Bathroom - We had a room with standard bed on first floor. Small room but I think this is common is Rome. Bed (queen bed) was fairly comfortable. Room had safe and mini fridge for use with no extra charge. No balcony but windows opened and gave you nice view of street. As mentioned above, we could hear lots of noise early in the morning so a room higher up or away from the street might be better. Furnishings were classic Italy style and looked updated as indicated on their website. Bathroom was very small which was ok but a bigger shower would have been nice. Service - Above average service. Hotel employees were very nice and accommodating. Although we did try to switch rooms after the first night without success because they were full. Breakfast - Typical Itallian breakfast with bread, cheese, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, yogurt, fruit; no meat. Overall - Nice hotel but it seemed a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: james068
Reviews.Content: Room was awful compared to the price. The dark haired woman on the door, the manager, was rude beyond belief. Ringing up late in the night disturbing my and my girlfriends sleep. They didn't notify me when my lost luggage arrived for two days and so went home without it. I cannot warn anyone enough about this place...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jason_Suzanne
Reviews.Content: The room was OK but noisy street at least while the bars and restaurants opposite are open. In terms of pluses, it has a good location for shops and bars. In terms of negatives, the service is poor, for 250E per night we would have at least expected some help with the bags when we arrived. TV channels had very little in English and the bathroom could have been cleaner. In all, there are better in the viccinity for similar or slightly more money.

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlZ
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Unpleasant staff. Rooms overlooking the street, very noisy. Rooms look like an old furniture's depot. Breakfast was ridiculously poor. In sum, this is an overpriced B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwbrouwer
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Hotel Piazza di Spagna over the Thanksgiving Holiday. It is in a terrific location right around the corner from the Spanish Steps. You couldn't ask for a better spot when touring in Rome. The hotel is a typical bed and breakfast and is very clean. The furnishings in the rooms are a bit worn and show it's age, but pretty much met expectations. The staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English. We used their concierge services to arrange for dinner reservations and for a tour and everything went exactly as planned. The hotel does include continental breakfast in the morning and if you are traveling during the summer, they have a very nice terrace. If you are looking for five star luxury, I would choose a different hotel. If you are looking for a simple, convenient B&B - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Our second time here, nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dcdogmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 1/2 years ago and liked it enough to go back. Since our last visit, the hotel has added a lovely breakfast room on the first floor. Before breakfast was served in the small lobby area. Our room was good sized with plenty of room to unpack. We were in the front of the hotel so it was loud if we had the windows open. The room and bathroom was spotless and kept that way during our entire visit. The new shower was small but the water pressure was great. Eugene, at the front desk, was very helpful with dinner reservations. He also was able to arrange a very good guide and driver to take us on a day trip to Tivoli. There was free internet access on a lobby computer and there was free access in all the guest rooms. We took advantage of the minibar (something that we rarely do) and the prices were very reasonable. (a half bottle of wine for around 4.5 euros). Overall, we really liked this hotel and would definately stay here again. It is small and family owened hotel. It is a block or so from the Spanish Steps and Rome's best shopping street is just a 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Italy for 7 days and spent 3 in Rome. Very good location, walking distance to all major sites even Vatican City and the Colloseum. Good continental breakfast in the breakfast room or brought to your room. Very nice setting, free internet in the lobby and very good nearby restaurants. Two short blocks to metro station and two stops from Termini train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (a bit noisy but you are in Rome), helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked out lots of 'hotel reviews' to find a quality hotel in Rome 'at the right price' and this one seemed to fit the bill. We paid Euros 210 per night (per room inc. breakfast) for a 'superior double'. the room was comfortable/neat/tidy and a reasonable size, but couldn't really be described as 'superior'. It's true, it is noisy, our room was on the front of the hotel and even though there are people dining below your window, the whole thing goes very quiet from 12.30 pm until the street cleaners (if that's what they were!) come along at 7.00 am (ish). Probably worth asking for a room at the back just to be on the safe side, or taking some earplugs!! Service at the hotel is faultless. This is a very nice area of Rome, the streets/shops/restaurants around the hotel are of the nicer variety (although a little more on the pricey-side). This is a very good hotel for the money in the virtual centre of Rome. On a personal note, I don't rate the Spanish Steps - very busy and dirty with lots of kids just 'hanging around'. Trevi Fountain on the other hand is a lovely place to dip your tired toes.....along with many other wonderful places to visit. Kids of all ages love it here and the Italians seem to treat children very well...... One word of warning, watch the traffic - often a bit like running the gauntlet - but once you have it sussed (if you stand on the kerb the car will not stop/if you cross the road, it will!!) Rome is a world beater time after time....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stevelup
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal if you want to be near the action. The Spanish Steps Piazza is just around the corner and there are 3 or 4 wonderful restaurants with outdoor seating on either side of the hotel. Shoppers beware: The Via Condotti is next to the hotel and has every high priced fashion boutique on the planet. The only negative to this hotel was the bathroom, which had an unpleasant odor upon our arrival and it never dissapated. I would rate it a 2 and 3/4 star hotel only for this reason. There is one computer in the lobby that is connected to the Internet and free to use on a first come, first served basis. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Piazza di Spagna”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I switched to this hotel from another and was extremely happy with my stay. While there is some noise from the musicians that play on the street in the evening, the friendly customer service and convenient location was excellent! They booked our tours and dinner reservations without a problem. When we went to the Vatican museums, we skipped an enormous line to meet our guide. The hotel even provided internet service in the lobby. The showers were amazing, they had jets that shot from all angles, which was refreshing after a long day of touring. The location was excellent as well. We walked to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and much more. I highly reccomend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be extremely charming, clean, and well-located. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They knew us by name immediately and were always cheerful and eager to offer any advice that we needed. I would definitely stay there again and look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into this hotel, and spent the entire first night completely awake because of a loud noise caused by a heating problem. The hotel could only apologize but didn't seem to want to take responsibility for it, wouldn't switch our room, and offered us only $20 off our room rate for our inconvenience. Also, I found the bathroom was never really cleaned so well. The only good thing I can say is that the hotel is in a great location, but I'd find another hotel to stay at the next time I visit Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Piazza di Spagna
HotelInfo.Address: Via Mario de' Fiori 61, 00187 Rome, Italy
